info.description: This is the REST API documentation for Workday Expenses. You can use the APIs and supported operations documented here to extend the functionality of Workday Expenses.
info.title: expense

tags.name: entries
tags.description: The Quick Expense that you can create, modify or submit. This can be an expense with a minimal set of fields.

tags.name: expenseItems
tags.description: The expense items that can be used on expense report lines.

tags.name: reports
tags.description: The expense reports that you can create, modify, or submit.

tags.name: Prompt Values
tags.description: Retrieves instances that can be used as values for other endpoint parameters in this service.

get.description: Retrieves instances that can be used as values for other endpoint parameters in this service. Secured by: Self-Service: Automated Expenses+TG-TG Scope: Expenses

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

parameters.name: expenseReportLine
parameters.description: Specifies the Expense Report Line instance that can be applied as a restriction to expense items.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default and maximum is 1000.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

get.summary: Retrieves a single instance of an Expense Report.
get.description: Retrieves details of an Expense Report referenced by its Workday Identifier (WID). Secured by: Self-Service: Expense Report Scope: Expenses

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

get.summary: Retrieves a single instance of an expense item.
get.description: Retrieves details of an Expense Item referenced by its Workday Identifier (WID). Secured by: Access Expense Item (Segmented), View: Expense Item Scope: Expenses

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

get.summary: Retrieves a single instance of a Quick Expense.
get.description: Retrieves a Quick Expense with the specified WID. Secured by: Self-Service: Expense Report Scope: Expenses Contains attachment(s)

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

put.summary: Updates an existing Quick Expense instance.
put.description: Updates an existing Quick Expense instance with the specified WID. Replaces the existing instance with the specified data in the request body. Secured by: Self-Service: Expense Report Scope: Expenses Contains attachment(s)

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data. Updating file.

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A1881 | Select a valid file extension type.
- | This quick expense cannot be modified because the expense status is not new.

delete.description: Deletes a Quick Expense with the specified WID. Secured by: Self-Service: Expense Report Scope: Expenses

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data. Deleting resource.

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)

Only quick expenses can be deleted.

This quick expense is on an expense report line and can not be deleted.

patch.description: Partially updates an existing Quick Expense with the specified WID for the fields provided in the request body. Secured by: Self-Service: Expense Report Scope: Expenses Contains attachment(s)

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data. Updating file.

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A1881 | Select a valid file extension type.
- | This quick expense cannot be modified because the expense status is not new.

get.description: Retrieves instances that can be used as values for other endpoint parameters in this service. Secured by: Self-Service: Automated Expenses+TG-TG Scope: Expenses

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

parameters.name: expenseReportLine
parameters.description: Specifies the Expense Report Line instance that can be applied as a restriction to expense items.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default and maximum is 1000.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

get.summary: Retrieves a collection of expense reports.
get.description: Retrieves a collection of expense reports. You can filter the reports by memo, status, and date. Secured by: Self-Service: Expense Report Scope: Expenses

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

post.summary: Creates a collection of expense report lines.
post.description: Creates an expense report line for an expense report with the specified ID. You can also create lines from Credit Card Transactions, Quick Expenses, or Travel Booking Records. Secured by: Self-Service: Expense Report Scope: Expenses

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)

Can only add Expenses to Expense Reports that are in Draft Status

Status of Credit Card Transaction to be added must be New

Status of Quick Expense to be added must be New

Status of Travel Booking Record to be added must be New

post.description: Secured by: Submit Expense Report (REST API) Scope: Expenses

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)

Can only submit Expense Reports that are in Draft Status.

[Custom exception message for expense report exception]

get.summary: Retrieves a collection of Quick Expenses.
get.description: Retrieves a collection of Quick Expenses for a user by the date in an ascending order. You can filter the entries by entry type, status, and date. Secured by: Self-Service: Expense Report Scope: Expenses Contains attachment(s)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

post.description: Creates a Quick Expense instance. In the request body, you must specify the required TransactionDate field. Secured by: Self-Service: Expense Report Scope: Expenses Contains attachment(s)

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A1881 | Select a valid file extension type.
- | Expense transaction date is required.
- | Receipt scanning is unavailable in your locale. You can still attach your receipt to the quick expense without submitting it for scanning.
- | There must be exactly 1 attachment for receipt scanning.

post.summary: Creates new attachments for the existing expense entry.
post.description: Creates attachments for the existing expense entry with the specified ID. Maximum file size is 32 MB. Secured by: Self-Service: Expense Report Scope: Expenses Contains attachment(s)

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A1881 | Select a valid file extension type.

get.summary: Retrieves a collection of expense items.
get.description: Retrieves a collection of expense items. When you don't specify the search string, Workday retrieves all expense items. Secured by: Access Expense Item (Segmented), View: Expense Item Scope: Expenses

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

id.description: Workday Id or Reference Id of the instance.

descriptor.description: The display name of the instance

code.description: The code that corresponds to the error message. Use the error code to drive programmatic error-handling behavior. Don't use error message strings for this purpose because they are subject to change

field.description: The field related to the error

path.description: The path of the field related to the error

items.description: This object represents the possible facets for this resource

facetParameter.description: The alias used to select the facet

count.description: The number of instances returned by this facet

id.description: Workday Id or Reference Id of the instance.
